meanings.definition: A line that divides something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The centerline split the cake perfectly in half.
meanings.sent2: The centerline of the ruler marked the exact middle point.
meanings.sent3: The magician cut the table in half along the centerline!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright centerline dividing the room.
meanings.sent5: The centerline of the river shimmered under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A line that runs through the center of something.
meanings.sent1: The centerline of the beam provided support along its length.
meanings.sent2: The centerline of the tunnel guided us through the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the centerline of the carpet, claiming it as her territory.
meanings.sent4: His words cut through her heart like a sharp centerline.
meanings.sent5: The centerline of the tree trunk showed its age with each ring.

meanings.definition: The middle line on a road.
meanings.sent1: The driver stayed on the centerline to keep the car in the middle of the lane.
meanings.sent2: The centerline on the highway helped drivers stay in their lanes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel balanced on the centerline, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: The centerline of the road stretched out like a never-ending path.
meanings.sent5: The centerline faded with each passing car, leaving only a faint trace.
